bibl.title: Letter from Alberto Recio to Philip Showalter Hench, August 7, 1941

div1.p: Recio informs Hench that he was able to locate the requested booklet and will send it to him. He plans to have an accurate survey made of the old Camp Lazear site.

div1.head: Letter from Alberto Recio to Philip Showalter Hench, August 7, 1941
div1.opener:
DR. ALBERTO RECIO
Habana
August 7, 1941.
Dr. Philip S. Hench.
Mayo Clinic.
Rochester, Minnesota.
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I wish to apologize for my delay in answering
your kind letter of July 11th, but this is due to the
fact that I was absent from my office for several days.

With respect to the booklet which you are inte-
rested to secure, I am pleased to advice you that I
have requested a copy of same from the librarian of the
Academy of Medicine as well as from the librarian of the
Finlay Institute, and I shall be very glad indeed to send
you this booklet as soon as I am able to obtain same.

I have been unable so for to have an accurate sur-
vey made of the old Camp Lazear as I had planned to do,
because of changes in personnel of the Department which
have taken place during the last few weeks, but however
I intend to have this done in the near future.

At the present time efforts are being made to fur-
ther develop the cultural relations which already exist
between our countries and for this reason I expect that
there shall be good opportunities for succesfully carry-
ing out your nice purposes.
With kindest personal regards, I am
